2026-02-10.content:
You can now launch clusters with the following Kubernetes versions. Click on the following links to see the release notes associated with these patches:

* [1.34.1-gke.4700](https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/multi-cloud/docs/aws/reference/supported-versions#1341-gke4700)
* [1.33.5-gke.1900](https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/multi-cloud/docs/aws/reference/supported-versions#1335-gke1900)
* [1.32.9-gke.1800](https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/multi-cloud/docs/aws/reference/supported-versions#1329-gke1800)

summary.title: New Kubernetes Versions Available
summary.summary: You can now launch clusters with updated Kubernetes versions 1.34.1-gke.4700, 1.33.5-gke.1900, and 1.32.9-gke.1800. Please refer to the release notes for details on each patch.

2026-01-30.content:
Multiple security vulnerabilities have been identified in the OpenSSL library.
The most significant finding is CVE-2025-15467, a critical vulnerability that
might allow for remote code execution (RCE) or denial of service (DoS) attacks
via network-based vectors.

For more details, see the [GCP-2026-006 security bulletin](https://docs.cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/security-bulletins#gcp-2026-006-gkeaws).

summary.title: OpenSSL Vulnerabilities Disclosed
summary.summary: Critical security flaws have been found in OpenSSL, including a vulnerability that could lead to remote code execution or denial of service. Users are advised to review the security bulletin for details and mitigation steps.
